decks.notes: The main concept of this UWx Control deck is to effectively control the board through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterbalance, Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Terminus, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition with Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. The deck also focuses on card selection and manipulation with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Search for Azcanta, allowing the pilot to consistently find the right answers and threats to maintain control of the game.

This UWx Control deck focuses on disruption and card advantage to outvalue opponents. By using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and outlast the opponent. Cards like Search for Azcanta and Snapcaster Mage provide additional card advantage, while sweepers like Terminus and Supreme Verdict can help stabilize against aggressive decks. The deck can also win through creature threats like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Entreat the Angels. Overall, the deck plays a reactive game plan and looks to grind out victories through incremental advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game through the use of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay. The deck also aims to maintain board presence and apply pressure with powerful creatures like True-Name Nemesis and Stoneforge Mystic fetching powerful equipment. The mana base is focused on disruption with cards like Wasteland and Daze, while also providing access to different colors for versatile spells. Leovold, Emissary of Trest provides card advantage and disruption, while Noble Hierarch ramps up mana and provides exalted triggers.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruptive spells to apply early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. By combining aggressive creatures like Knight of the Reliquary and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben with powerful equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and Sword of Fire and Ice, the deck aims to quickly close out games while also disrupting the opponent with cards like Wasteland and Thalia. With mana acceleration from cards like Noble Hierarch and Gaea's Cradle, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent and control the pace of the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling your graveyard with powerful creatures like Jin-Gitaxias, Griselbrand, and Elesh Norn using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then using reanimation spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead to put them into play by bypassing their mana costs. Additionally, utilizing cards like Show and Tell can cheat your creatures into play even faster. The deck also includes protection in the form of Force of Will and Chancellor of the Annex to ensure your combo goes off smoothly and your opponent's answers are countered.

The main concept of this UWx Control Legacy deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage with cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Snapcaster Mage. The deck focuses on setting up a powerful late-game win condition with Entreat the Angels and Search for Azcanta, while also utilizing powerful card selection tools like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistency in drawing the necessary answers. The mana base is designed to support the deck's color requirements while providing access to powerful lands like Wasteland and Karakas.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent through a combination of cheap and efficient creatures such as Delver of Secrets, Deathrite Shaman, and Young Pyromancer. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Wasteland, Spell Pierce, and Force of Will, while maintaining card advantage and card selection with Brainstorm and Ponder. The inclusion of True-Name Nemesis and Gurmag Angler provides additional threats that can be difficult for the opponent to handle, resulting in a fast-paced and aggressive playstyle.

This deck focuses on controlling the board with cards like Liliana of the Veil, Chalice of the Void, Punishing Fire, and Abrupt Decay. It also utilizes the Life from the Loam engine to recur lands and maximize resource advantage. The deck aims to lock down the opponent's strategy while generating value through Knight of the Reliquary, Dark Confidant, and Sylvan Library. By using cards like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter to disrupt the opponent's mana base, the deck aims to grind out a victory over time using incremental advantage and card advantage.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro deck is to control the board early on with disruptive spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Cabal Therapy, while utilizing efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes versatile cards like Deathrite Shaman and True-Name Nemesis for additional utility and resilience. The deck's mana base is streamlined with Wasteland and fetch lands to ensure consistent access to its three main colors of mana.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently dump powerful creatures into the graveyard and bring them back into play using spells like Reanimate, Exhume, and Animate Dead. Creatures like Griselbrand, Elesh Norn, and Tidespout Tyrant provide game-ending threats that can swing the game in your favor. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Unmask and Thoughtseize to control the opponent's hand and keep the combo going smoothly. The mana acceleration from cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal ensures you can cast your spells quickly and overwhelm your opponent.

The deck focuses on combining fast mana acceleration with graveyard manipulation to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with large threats early in the game, supported by counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The deck aims to win through a powerful reanimator strategy that bypasses traditional methods of casting creatures, leading to explosive plays and a strong advantage in the early game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, card draw, and removal spells such as Force of Will, Counterspell, and Swords to Plowshares. The deck aims to build card advantage with cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Snapcaster Mage while also having control over the board with cards like Terminus, Council's Judgment, and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The inclusion of cards like Search for Azcanta and Counterbalance adds further flexibility and control options, making it difficult for opponents to gain an advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana through spells such as Dark Ritual and Cabal Ritual, then use cards like Infernal Tutor to search for specific combo pieces like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam to win the game. Cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain help with card selection and manipulation, while disruption cards like Duress and Cabal Therapy can help disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to quickly storm off and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up its mana using Cloudpost and other powerful lands, allowing for the casting of huge Eldrazi threats like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Kozilek, Butcher of Truth. Trinisphere and Chalice of the Void help disrupt opponents' strategies, while cards like Thought-Knot Seer provide disruption and card advantage. The deck also has ways to protect itself from threats with All Is Dust and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, making it a formidable force in the late game.

The deck focuses on using disruptive spells like Wasteland, Stifle, and Daze to control the opponent's resources while deploying efficient threats like Delver of Secrets, True-Name Nemesis, and Gurmag Angler to pressure the opponent. The deck aims to be proactive, using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to find the right cards at the right time. Force of Will and Lightning Bolt provide additional disruption and removal to help clear the way for the aggressive creatures to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck is all about tempo and efficiency, punishing opponents for stumbling or falling behind.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a powerful win condition with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo. The deck aims to use cards like Wasteland, Ghost Quarter, and Maze of Ith to disrupt the opponent's mana base and creatures, while using Life from the Loam to continuously recur lands from the graveyard. Additionally, Punishing Fire helps to control the board and provide recurring removal. The goal is to outlast the opponent and eventually win with a massive 20/20 Marit Lage token.
